Package fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.rendezvous

package fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.rendezvous

The rendezvous pattern.

It is based on the observer pattern. The GridNode interface defines the callRendezvous(...) method used to execute an action at a rendezvous.

AbstractGridNode implements a final version of callRendezvous(...), as this method is too important to allow overriding. callRendezvous(...) is synchronized so that different threads can access the rendezvous and share information. AbstractGridNode maintains a list of different rendezvous that can be called depending on a message type which is just an integer.

The RendezvousProcess interface contains the code to be executed at the rendezvous, i.e. GridNode.callRendezvous(...) will call the correct RendezvousProcess.execute(...).

Finally, RVMessage, which is the argument to GridNode.callRendezvous(...) contains information about the type of process and any other parameters required by RendezvousProcess.execute(...).

To use the rendezvous pattern you must declare your own descendant of AbstractGridNode and RendezvousProcess. See examples of implementation in referenced packages below.

Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 1 juin 2021
See Also:
fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.rendezvous.examples, fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.statemachine
  • Interface Summary
    Interface
    Description
    GridNode
    The extension of Observer required by the rendezvous pattern.
    RendezvousProcess
    Any action that must be executed at a rendezvous.
  • Class Summary
    Class
    Description
    AbstractGridNode
    Implementation of GridNode.
    RVMessage
    Data exchanged between two GridNodes at rendezvous.
    RVMessageHeader
    Message header for rendezvous messages.
